headline.main: Suit Says Homes Were Built on Bomb Range

lead_paragraph: KB Home, one of the largest home builders in the nation, was sued this week by 64 homeowners who say that the company knowingly built their dwellings on a former military target range that contains unexploded bombs. In a lawsuit filed in Texas state court, residents of the Southridge Hills development in Arlington say KB Home knew when it bought the land in the 1990's that the Navy had used it for bombing practice during World War II.
abstract: Sixty-four homeowners sue KB Home, charging KB knowingly built their Arlington, Tex, houses on former military target range that contains unexploded bombs (S)
